column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.

ACD/pKa GALAS algorithm is a multi-step procedure involving estimation of pKa microconstants for all possible ionization centers in a hypothetical state of an uncharged molecule ("fundamental microconstants")
column2: numerous corrections of these initial pKa values according to the surrounding of the reaction center and calculation of charge influences of ionized groups to the neighbouring ionization centers. Calculation routine utilizes a database of 4
column4: a set of ca. 500 various interaction constants and four interaction calculation methods for different types of interactions
column5: producing a full range of microconstants from which pKa macroconstants are obtained. This allows for a simulation of complete distribution plot of all protonation states of the molecule at different pH conditions.

column1: The raw calculation results were obtained using ACD/Percepta Kernel API with pKa calculation algorithm set to "GALAS". The raw results were processed with a custom Python script in order to normalize the structures in the provided microstates lists with respect to differences in tautomeric forms and/or resonance structures
column2: match the predicted protonation states with given microstate IDs
column4: generate the output in the required format.
